result.execSummary:
The defendant Katherine Mae Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Trempealeau Co. Case Nos. 14 CM 132 and 15 CF 20.    In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.
Defendant is to receive an AODA evaluation and follow through with any treatment.
Defendant is not to consume/possess alcohol or enter bars/taverns.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant must contact Clerk of Courts within 60 days to set up payment plan.    If not paid, one day in jail for each $40.00 of unpaid fines.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
